lead_paragraph: President Bush carried his re-election campaign west today, only to run into the same assertion voiced by some supporters elsewhere: that he lacked substance and conviction. It was all the more stinging because it appeared to come from a most unlikely source, former President Ronald Reagan. And Mr. Bush's political advisers rushed to rebut it.

headline.main: THE 1992 CAMPAIGN: White House; Bush Goes West; Criticism of Message Follows
